root.title: “Muhar” Memorial Complex, The
root.history: One of the most ancient memorial complexes devoted to a Turkic kagan.
root.place: The complex is located on northwest coast of Tuul river in 88 km west of city Ulaanbaatar in Altanbulag sum of Töv aimag in Mongolia at N47º12´312´´ - E105º32´082´´, 1066 m above the sea level.
root.store: The memorial is on its site. Some fragments are lost.
root.general: The memorial complex includes ditches, a stone box, stone sculptures (3 units), a lion statue, a sheep statue, balbals – line of erected stones (221? units).
root.investigation: N.M.Yadrintsev 479 conducted research of the complex in 1891. D.A.Klements conducted research in 1893. The Soviet-Mongolian historical and cultural expedition conducted archeological excavations. V.E.Voitov 480, D.Bayar 481 made scientific descriptions in 1987.

refs.ref: Войтов В.Е. Каменные изваяния из Унгету. / Центарльная Азия. Новые памятники и исскуства. М.,1987. С. 97-109.
Ядринцев Н.М. Отчет и дневник с путешествия по Орхону и в южный Хангай в 1891 г. // Труды Орхонской экспедиции. Т. Y, 1892.
Войтов В.Е. Древнетюркский пантеон и модель мироздания в культово-поминальных памятниках Монголии VI-VIII в. М., 1996. С. 41.
